article_text:
It isn’t easy to lose an election by 4 to 1, but Michigan Republicans and their business allies managed the feat on Tuesday when voters hooted down a $2 billion tax hike supposedly earmarked to fix state roads.

Governor Rick Snyder and the GOP legislature pushed Proposal 1, which would have amended the Michigan constitution to allow raising the sales tax to 7% from 6%, rejiggering the way gas is taxed and raising vehicle registration fees. The package also included an expansion of the earned-income tax credit, money for...

twitter.description: Voters demolish a $2 billion sales tax increase, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Michigan’s Road Kill

article_summary:
The package also included an expansion of the earned-income tax credit, money for...
Governor Rick Snyder and the GOP legislature pushed Proposal 1, which would have amended the Michigan constitution to allow raising the sales tax to 7% from 6%, rejiggering the way gas is taxed and raising vehicle registration fees.
It isn’t easy to lose an election by 4 to 1, but Michigan Republicans and their business allies managed the feat on Tuesday when voters hooted down a $2 billion tax hike supposedly earmarked to fix state roads.
